item.title: TypeScript-aware React hooks for global state
item.description: React hooks are awesome. React Hooks API is a new proposal for React v16.7. It enables writing all components as functions with full functionality. You can develop “custom hooks” to add a new functionality. Although it’s not released yet, I would like to introduce a new library to support global state. Note that it’s still an experiment. The library It’s called “react-hooks-global-state” and is available in npm. Please also checkout the GitHub repository.

item.title: React global state by Context API
item.description: A tiny library to help storing global state in React. I had been trying to find a way to use React without using class. Redux is one solution to achieve this. Although I love the idea of writing everthing in pure functions, Redux is sometimes not suitable for small apps. React v16.3 introduced new Context API officially. Since then, several ideas were proposed to use it for managing global state.
